page.title: 12Transport
page.content: Dyserth and Meliden at one time had their own Railway stations linked to Prestatyn. Both passengers and freight were transported along the line, particulary stone and lime from the nearby quarries. The track bed has however been removed since its closure in 1980.Plans are in hand to restore the service by the North Clwyd Railway Assocation. Most people today use cars for their own private transport.Those who do not own a car make use of the public service, provided by the National Crosville Bus Company which runs regular scheduled services throughout the area.Dyserth does however have its own Private Bus Company,Voel Coaches, which provides local,national and foreign trips and holidays.They also take children on school trips and convey pupils to schools in Clwyd.
